passport.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a small official document that you get from your government, that proves who you are, and which you need in order to leave your country and enter other countries
passport.translation[0].definitions[0].e: They need to check that your passport is in order.
passport.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: You can apply for an Italian passport if your parents are Italian.
It took quite a long time to get a new passport.
I'd forgotten to renew my passport.
The men were convicted of travelling on a false passport.
She was born in India but has a British passport.
For travel abroad, you must have a valid passport.
He used a false passport to enter Kenya.
British passport holders must obtain a visa before entering the country.
passport.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a small book containing a personâ€™s name and photograph, given by a government to a citizen. It proves who the person is and allows them to leave or enter countries
